first_para: Michael Louis David Fabricant (born 12 June 1950) is a British Conservative Party politician. He is the incumbent candidate for Lichfield in Staffordshire, at the 2015 UK general election.

full.extract:
Michael Louis David Fabricant (born 12 June 1950) is a British Conservative Party politician. He is the incumbent candidate for Lichfield in Staffordshire, at the 2015 UK general election.
Michael Fabricant was the Vice-Chairman of the Conservative Party for Parliamentary Campaigning, responsible for Conservative headquarters strategy on marginal seats at the 2015 general election, as well as by-elections. He was dismissed from this position in April 2014 over the HS2 rail link debacle and comments made about Maria Miller's resignation.
^ "Lichfield Parliament Constituency". BBC News. Retrieved 21 April 2015. 
^ "Michael Fabricant". parliament.uk. 2013. Retrieved 11 May 2013. 
^ "Leak from Tories in Corby: "We have more pledges than Labour"". Political Scrapbook. 14 November 2012. Retrieved 11 May 2013. 
^ Morris, Nigel (26 November 2012). "'It's war': Nigel Farage flatly rejects call from senior Tory for Ukip and Conservative EU pact at the general election". The Independent (London: INM). ISSN 0951-9467. OCLC 185201487. Retrieved 11 May 2013.
full.title: Michael Fabricant
